column4: guys can someone tell me what ./configure -> make -> make install does ?

configure set up options that are customized to your specific system. make compiles the source code into executable form, and make install then moves the executable program to its final resting place(s).
hmm, make and make install made sense, but configure didn't...

many programs have dustomizeable options, and even make itself has to know where to put things. the "where" depends on the distro among other things, so configure does a lot of testing to determine what's needed on your system as opposed to a slackware or fedora installation. source files are "one size fits all" and configure does the fitting...
